[GAME] Analysis – Hero (P1) holds 2♥ 10♠, board K♦ 2♦ 4♥.

- Made hand: bottom pair (pair of 2s with ten kicker).
- Equity: modest (against a single opponent). Any king, pocket 4s, any diamond draw, A♦ suited, JT, 32, or even air with overcards could all still be in P0’s range.
- Pot odds: free to see the turn (current bet = 0); betting now builds the pot but risks getting raised off our hand.
- Position & stack depth: out of position. Effective stack = 980.

Action plan: Want to see the turn cheaply. No need to bloat the pot yet—check, then decide based on P0’s action and the next card.

[Check]

rounds.response:
My hand: King-Jack offsuit (Kd Jc)
Board: 7c Qd 6c
Current situation: Pot = 240, villain has bet 120 on the flop; 960 chips remaining for me.

Range assessment: villain limped UTG/SB then check-raised pre-flop, then fired a continuation bet that’s half-pot. Typical range here includes many over-pairs, top-pair type hands (AQ/KQ), and some draws. I currently have K-high with a gut-shot Broadway draw (10-9-8-X outs are really weak, since I have no spades and the Q is on board). Against this sizing, I’m likely behind.

Facing a 120 bet in a 240 pot with only K-high, calling or raising would basically be a bluff; my equity is low. Better to fold and preserve chips early in the series.

[Fold]
